Control layer:
Experimentation:
  • Generating random joint angles with constraints and sending them to the robot interface
  • Performing transformations on output images, and organize data such that the experiment can be bundled together
Motion planning: 
  • Takes in policy
  • Performs transformations on output images, and then 

Robot interaction layer
Robot interface
  • Sends and receives joint positions and velocities. Can do this with varying levels of verbosity. Can also save this into text file.
  • Smoothing out of velocities so that very little jolt in the robot arm?
  • Verifies that sends and receives have the same values, otherwise logs information to debug the program.
  • Accesses the raspi camera to take footages/camera frames at time increments, saves to file
  • Has a standby position that it can go to. 

Send/Receive layer:
Sending data: Pi —> Arduino
  • specifying the angle of the joints (maximums and minimums)
  • specifying the speed of movement for each joint. 
  • Transistor on/off for the robot end effector / joint 1
Receiving data: Arduino —> Pi
  • the angle sent to each joint, and the time at which this happens
  • the delay between angle writes, dictating speed.
  • When the end effector is fully developed: The pressure readings
